title: Low Informal Payments to Public Officials
description: In 2023, only 0.1% of firms in Bosnia and Herzegovina reported making informal payments to public officials, indicating a low level of corruption in business dealings.

title: Minimal Impact of Health Expenditure on Poverty
description: As of 2015, only 0.01% of the population was pushed below the $2.15 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses, reflecting a strong social safety net.

title: Small Air Freight Transport Sector
description: In 2015, Bosnia and Herzegovina's air transport sector handled just 0.000087 million ton-km of freight, highlighting a limited capacity in air logistics.

title: Moderate Urban Population Concentration
description: By 2024, Sarajevo, the largest city in Bosnia and Herzegovina, is projected to have a population of 346,859, indicating a moderate level of urbanization.

title: Aging Female Population
description: In 2023, 7.69% of the female population in Bosnia and Herzegovina was aged between 65-69, suggesting an aging demographic that may impact future workforce dynamics.
